text:
Hey <@U04N6N424MB>, sorry for any disruption! We ran into some issues maintaining the boilerplate code when we were adding the ability to use different HS api client versions. We <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/workflows/custom-code-actions|moved the boiler plate code into the documentation> instead so you can still pop in there and copy paste.

How important is it for you to have the boilerplate code default on the custom code action vs having to go to the documentation for it?
Pretty important from my perspective, I had to delete all the comments and all the other boilerplate code, but the start function and the return was super helpful
is all I need tbh - i work with so many different node js parsers that I forget which niche HubSpot uses and it was nice to just go in and see
especially for Import Fields because that's something that is arguably core to CCA's
Awesome, I appreciate that helpful perspective. Iâ€™m going to take this feedback back to our engineers and see what we can come up with.
